text: Systems improve with data instead of explicit rules.
Supervised learning maps inputs to labeled outputs.
Train, validation, and test splits support evaluation.
Carbon taxes and cap-and-trade are policy instruments.
PID controllers combine proportional, integral, and derivative terms.
Failure rates follow the bathtub curve.
Interface design reduces operator error by matching mental models.
Critical path analysis identifies schedule-defining tasks.
Demand response shifts usage to reduce peak strain.
The grid is modeled as an MDP with load, storage, and renewable output.
PPO reduces peak demand by roughly twelve percent.
Entropy coefficient tuning is required for dense policy gradients.
